item.title: The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1
item.description:
The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1

How a 29-year-old idealist built a global drug bazaar and became a murderous kingpin.

item.title: Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius
item.description:
Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius

Karl Ove Knausgård, a Norwegian now domiciled with his wife and four kids in Sweden, is perhaps the world's most revered living writer. Only, if he were American, the principal thing he and everyone else would say about him is that he is an alcoholic.

item.title: Rob Ford, former Toronto mayor, dies aged 46
item.description:
Rob Ford, former Toronto mayor, dies aged 46

Rob Ford, the pugnacious, populist former mayor of Toronto whose career crashed in a drug-driven, obscenity-laced debacle, died on Tuesday after fighting cancer, his family says. He was 46. Ford rode into office on a backlash against urban elites. He cast an image sharply at odds with Canada's reputation for sedate, unpretentious politics.

item.title: Rethink Drug Policy - Health Poverty Action
item.description:
Rethink Drug Policy - Health Poverty Action

Health Poverty Action is calling for a new approach to drug policy, which puts people's health and rights first. Take action and support our rethink on drug policy: https://www.healthpovertyaction.org/s... Our animation explores how global drug policies affect ordinary people around the world, sharing the stories of Lae, Fatima, Maria and Oumar.

item.title: Mothers call for end to drug wars at severed head victim's vigil - NL Times
item.description:
Mothers call for end to drug wars at severed head victim's vigil - NL Times

Crime, Netherlands, Top Stories - Some 200 people took part in a silent vigil for 23-year-old Dutch-Moroccan Nabil Amzieb in Amsterdam on Sunday.

item.title: Painkillers now kill more Americans than any illegal drug. Watch why.
item.description:
Painkillers now kill more Americans than any illegal drug. Watch why.

Since the 1990s, doctors have been under more and more pressure to treat pain as a serious medical issue. Pharmaceutical companies took advantage of this desire, marketing opioid painkillers like OxyContin and Vicodin as a safe, effective solution to pain. The result: Millions of Americans got hooked on the drugs, and tens of thousands have died from overdoses.

item.title: Drug Consumption Room DOC
item.description:
Drug Consumption Room DOC

This Documentary invites the audience to see the harsh reality of 'street injecting' drug users in the UK's second city Birmingham. The presenter Philippe Bonnet explores this subject by interviewing outreach workers, health care professionals and current and ex drug-users.

item.title: Ibogaine update
item.description:
Ibogaine update

Well readers, I have a treat for you! Ten years ago David Graham Scott (whom we have written about and written with on this website) screened a very personal documentary on channel 4, about his own experience as a person struggling to finally quit using methadone -by using ibogaine.

item.title: The medical marijuana mess: A prescription for fixing a broken policy
item.description:
The medical marijuana mess: A prescription for fixing a broken policy

In 2013, Patrick and Beth Collins were desperate. Thirteen‐year‐old Jennifer, the younger of their two children, faced a life‐threatening situation. In response, the Collins family took extreme measures-sending Jennifer thousands of miles away in the company of her mother.

item.title: Many European Doctors Still Think Homosexuality Is A Disease, 'Shocking' Report Finds
item.description:
Many European Doctors Still Think Homosexuality Is A Disease, 'Shocking' Report Finds

The revelation that many European doctors continue to believe homosexuality is a disease has been slammed as "shocking" by LGBT charities. A report from the European Union Agency for Fundamental Rights found a "large proportion" of healthcare professionals in some EU countries identify being gay as "a pathological problem".
